intro: Arrojadoa multiflora, commonly known as the Brazilian star-of-Bahia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments. It has hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Arrojadoa multiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in tropical regions.
